question: 住民
userExplanation:
3 AI agree that
<ja>住人:</ja> general word for someone living somewhere
<ja>住民:</ja> more formal/official, related to legal rights, status, particiption in the community etc
sourceMnemonic: They <kanji>dwell</kanji> here, these <kanji>people</kanji>. So what are they? They’re <vocabulary>residents</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
